1. Leave request expiration: The system should allow for the setting of expiration dates for leave requests to ensure that requests are either approved or denied in a timely manner. This will help to prevent backlogs of outstanding leave requests.
2. Leave request comments: The system should allow for the inclusion of comments or notes when submitting a leave request. This will allow employees to provide additional information or context to their request and will help managers to make more informed decisions.
3. Leave request attachments: The system should allow for the attachment of supporting documentation, such as a doctor's note, to leave requests. This will help to ensure that all necessary information is provided upfront and will streamline the approval process.
4. Leave request edits: The system should allow for the editing of leave requests after they have been submitted, in the event that plans change or additional information becomes available. This will help to minimize the need for leave cancellations or rescheduling.
5. Leave request history: The system should keep a record of all leave requests, including those that have been approved, denied, or cancelled. This will allow employees and managers to see a complete history of leave requests and to track changes over time.
